headline: Adam Morgan challenges Paul Gosar for Congress
author: tsn-thestandard
sentences:
I certainly think that’s something that I can bring to the district in terms of transportation, water, and mining and things that I think the federal government should be helping out with.”
Morgan said he began visiting and spending time in Kingman a few years ago before purchasing a home last May.

“I decided very late in January that I was going to throw my hat in the ring and try to provide a better choice for all of the residents of the district.”
Morgan said he’s been building support among political and civic clubs and visiting businesses within the district from Yuma to Kingman.
“One of the largest challenges for government and elected officials is making sure that money that is set aside for projects and programs finds its way to where it’s finally intended.
Adam Morgan is a West Point graduate and former U.S. Army Airborne Ranger who currently works cyber security for a firm under contract with the U.S. government.
MOHAVE COUNTY – A Kingman resident has quietly launched a Republican primary challenge to re-lection seeking 4th District Congressman Paul Gosar.
He invites interested residents and voters to learn more about his candidacy and campaign by viewing his www.morgan4az.com website.
He said he didn’t move to Arizona to run against Gosar but decided to do so upon learning the incumbent is ineffective.
“I understand the bureaucracy around Washington D.C. without having ever been a bureaucrat, fortunately,” Morgan said.
“The representation that we have is insufficient and we need better,” Morgan said.
